text:
When this hotel/ Is your home,/ This sidewalk/ Is your porch.

/ And on this day when/ Smoke/ Hangs in the discolored/ Air

/ The stalled cars vibrating (humming)/ In late September heat/ Are a mess of dogs/ Urinating sweat and gasoline/ Onto your lawn.

/ When they sit, you/ Shuffle noisily past/ The muzzled (muffled) lot,

/ You greet your neighbors on the other side./ Your small talk burns the afternoon./
